text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Today we are gonna be making something that
I have been getting so many requests for.

I’ve been getting a lot of, hint, Kingdom
Hearts requests for,
Sea Salt Ice Cream Popsicles.

It’s summertime, I thought this was a perfect
fit, so let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 2 cups
of milk, 1 cup of heavy whipping cream,

1/3 cup of regular sugar, 1 and 1/2 teaspoons
of vanilla extract, 2 eggs,

some sea salt, you’ll also need 2 food coloring
dyes, ones gonna be royal blue,

and one’s gonna be leaf green. You’ll
also need a mixer, I’m using just a

hand mixer, but you can use a stand mixer,
what ever you’d like.

You also need 2 big bowls, oh! Like so, and
some popsicle trays.

Now these trays, you’ll just want a rounded
bottom, anything so it will look

like the video game. I ordered these ones
online I’ll put a link down below
so if you want to check ‘em out.

Last but not least, you’ll need some Wooden
popsicle sticks, I found these I think

at Michaels or something, I’ll try to find
those and put a link too.
OK, let’s put it all together!

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
we’re gonna take our eggs, and we’re gonna

separate our egg whites and our egg yolks
into these two bowls.

So you’re just gonna take an egg, and put
the egg white into this bowl, let it

drip out, and then put your egg yolk over
here, boop!

Now it’s time to mix, the first thing that
we’re gonna mix are our egg whites,

this will take a few minutes, just wait until
they start to form peaks like a
meringue. And then we’re gonna move over here and we're gonna mix together our sugar and yolks until

it’s really thick. Once you’ve mixed up
your two egg mixtures, now you’re gonna

take your 2 cups of milk and we’re gonna
head over to the stove with a
medium sized saucepan.

Pour your milk into the medium sized saucepan
and slowly bring the milk to a boil,

on about a medium heat. You’re gonna want
to stir occasionally because milk can burn!

Remove the milk from the stove and then you’re
gonna pour it into the bowl with
the sugar and the egg yolks.

Then you’re gonna take your mixer again and mix
it together again until everything is
evenly combined.

Now that you’ve mixed this all together,
doo-dew-doo-doo-dew! We are gonna pour

it back into our medium sized saucepan on
the burner, but this time you’re gonna

keep it on LOW heat, you do not want it to
boil. You just keep it on the heat,

slowly stirring until it becomes a thick,
like custard.

Once your mixture is like a custard, you’re
gonna take it off of the stove,

and then we’re gonna pour it into our egg
white mixture. Just slowly pour it in.

Then you’re gonna mix it together on a low
speed until everything is combined
and add some sea salt.

When you’re adding your sea salt, just make
sure it’s a good balance between

sweet and salty, I do not have an exact measurement
because everybody has a

different liking, to this, but start small
and then keep adding until it’s that
perfect balance between sweet and salty!
Do a little taste test, are you salty enough?
Oh that’s so good!
Oh!
Uh, a little bit more salt.

Little bit more salt in your game! Salt in
your games!
OH! Yeah, that’s it! Perfect!

Now you’re gonna take this mixture and you’re
gonna place it in the refrigerator

for about 5 minutes to chill, and then we’ll
add our final ingredients!

Once your mixture has cooled from being in the fridge,
we’re gonna add our 1 cup of
heavy cream… Weeeeeee!!!!
And some vanilla extract.

Then we’re gonna mix it up one more time
and then add our food coloring.

Now, when you’re adding your food colorings,
what you’re gonna do is

add 7 drops of blue, 1 drop of green. That’s
the color that I found looks
closest to the video game.

Now you’re gonna mix it up until your color
is evenly combined, it should
look like that beautiful blue!

To make things a little bit easier, I transferred
our popsicle mixture into

this little measuring cup because it has this
little pour spigot.

Then you’re gonna take out your popsicle
molds, and you’re gonna fill them
up, carefully! Doo-Doo-Dee-Doo-Doo-Doo-Doo!!!

Leave a little bit of room at the top, because
when we put our sticks in it
will make the liquid rise a little bit.

Once you’ve filled these molds, you’re
gonna put these in the freezer for 1 hour,

and in 1 hour, this liquid is going to get
a little bit more firm, and that’s

when we’ll stick in the popsicle sticks.
because they will stay in position.

If you put them in before then, they might
lean off to the side, so just put them

in the freezer for 1 hour, let them get a
little bit more firm, and then
put in the popsicle sticks!

Ta-da! Here are the Kingdom Hearts Sea Salt
Ice Cream Popsicles that we made!
They’re so cute, and perfect for the summertime!
I couldn’t think of a more perfect treat!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it, this was
really fun to make!

I’ll post lots of pictures of these little
creations on Facebook, Tumblr,

Twitter and Instagram, and if you guys make
these, please send me pictures!

I get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations, they just make me happy,
they make my day!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
I’m so salty! Doo-doo-doo-doo-dooooo!
